org.waarp.openr66.protocol.http.restv2.dbhandlers

Class TransferIdHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.cdap.http.AbstractHttpHandler
      • org.waarp.openr66.protocol.http.restv2.dbhandlers.AbstractRestDbHandler
        • org.waarp.openr66.protocol.http.restv2.dbhandlers.TransferIdHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.cdap.http.HttpHandler

    @Path(value="/v2/transfers//{id}")
public class TransferIdHandler
extends AbstractRestDbHandler
    This is the AbstractRestDbHandler handling all requests made on the single transfer REST entry point.

    • Method Detail

      • getTransfer

        @GET
@Consumes(value="*/*")
public void getTransfer(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request,
                            io.cdap.http.HttpResponder responder,
                            @PathParam(value="id")
                            String uri)
                 throws UnsupportedEncodingException
        Method called to obtain the information on the transfer whose id was given in the request's URI. The requested transfer is sent back in JSON format, unless an unexpected error prevents it or if the request id does not exist.

        **NOTE:** The uri parameter refers to the concatenation of the transfer's id, and the name of the host to which the transfer was requested, separated by an underscore character.

        Parameters:
        request - the HttpRequest made to the resource
        responder - the HttpResponder which sends the reply to the request
        uri - the transfer's unique identifier
        Throws:
        UnsupportedEncodingException

      • restartTransfer

        @Path(value="restart")
@PUT
@Consumes(value="*/*")
public void restartTransfer(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request,
                                     io.cdap.http.HttpResponder responder,
                                     @PathParam(value="id")
                                     String uri)
                     throws UnsupportedEncodingException
        Method called to restart a paused transfer.

        **NOTE:** The uri parameter refers to the concatenation of the transfer's id, and the name of the host to which the transfer was requested, separated by an underscore character.

        Parameters:
        request - the HttpRequest made to the resource
        responder - the HttpResponder which sends the reply to the request
        uri - the transfer's unique identifier
        Throws:
        UnsupportedEncodingException

      • stopTransfer

        @Path(value="stop")
@PUT
@Consumes(value="*/*")
public void stopTransfer(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request,
                                  io.cdap.http.HttpResponder responder,
                                  @PathParam(value="id")
                                  String uri)
                  throws UnsupportedEncodingException
        Method called to pause a staged or running transfer.

        **NOTE:** The uri parameter refers to the concatenation of the transfer's id, and the name of the host to which the transfer was requested, separated by an underscore character.

        Parameters:
        request - the HttpRequest made to the resource
        responder - the HttpResponder which sends the reply to the request
        uri - the transfer's unique identifier
        Throws:
        UnsupportedEncodingException

        @Path(value="cancel")
@PUT
@Consumes(value="*/*")
public void cancelTransfer(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request,
                                    io.cdap.http.HttpResponder responder,
                                    @PathParam(value="id")

                    throws UnsupportedEncodingException

        Parameters:
        request - the HttpRequest made to the resource
        responder - the HttpResponder which sends the reply to the request

      • options

        @OPTIONS
@Consumes(value="*/*")
public void options(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request,
                            io.cdap.http.HttpResponder responder,
                            @PathParam(value="id")
                            String uri)
        Method called to get a list of all allowed HTTP methods on this entry point. The HTTP methods are sent as an array in the reply's headers.

        **NOTE:** The uri parameter refers to the concatenation of the transfer's id, and the name of the host to which the transfer was requested, separated by an underscore character.

        Parameters:
        request - the HttpRequest made to the resource
        responder - the HttpResponder which sends the reply to the request
        uri - the transfer's unique identifier

                                     String uri,
                                     @PathParam(value="ep")
